abstract: Among the many Libyans who took sides, and even took up arms, in the country's civil war were members of its national soccer team.
snippet: Among the many Libyans who took sides, and even took up arms, in the country's civil war were members of its national soccer team.
lead_paragraph: Among the many Libyans who took sides in the country's civil war were members of its national soccer team. A former captain of the team called the anti-Qaddafi rebels rats and dogs, while several of his teammates took up arms against the crumbling government. James Montague visited the reconstituted team in Zambia, where on Saturday it will try to clinch a berth in next year's African Cup of Nations. Read his article here, and come back to comment.

headline.main: Split by War, Libya's Team Reunites With a New Goal
